framework: DSV (Deconstruct, Synthesize, and Verify) - Ablation Version
input_sentence: ego vehicle is on the road and there is a continuous line present on the road, then the ego vehicle must not cross or straddle the continuous line.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is on the road
Continuous line is present on the road
Ego vehicle crosses the continuous line
Ego vehicle straddles the continuous line

temporal_relations.description: If ego is on road and continuous line is present, then ego must not cross or straddle the line

lexicon.ego_on_road: Ego vehicle is on the road
lexicon.line_present: Continuous line is present on the road
lexicon.ego_crosses_line: Ego vehicle crosses the continuous line
lexicon.ego_straddles_line: Ego vehicle straddles the continuous line

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_continuous_line → continuous_line

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: on_road(ego) [object: ego, related_object: null]
   - ap_2: present(continuous_line) [object: continuous_line, related_object: null]
   - ap_3: crosses(ego,continuous_line) [object: ego, related_object: continuous_line]
   - ap_4: straddles(ego,continuous_line) [object: ego, related_object: continuous_line]

3. Build the implication from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)
   - Consequent: ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line))
   - Combined: (on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) -> ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator:
   - G((on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) -> ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line)))

Final MTL Formula:
G((on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) -> ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_continuous_line → continuous_line

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: on_road(ego) [object: ego, related_object: null]
   - ap_2: present(continuous_line) [object: continuous_line, related_object: null]
   - ap_3: crosses(ego,continuous_line) [object: ego, related_object: continuous_line]
   - ap_4: straddles(ego,continuous_line) [object: ego, related_object: continuous_line]

3. Build the implication from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)
   - Consequent: ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line))
   - Combined: (on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) -> ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator:
   - G((on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) -> ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line)))

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- First, I identify the main structure: G(φ -> ψ) which means "Always, if φ then ψ"
- φ is (on_road(ego) & present(continuous_line)) which translates to "ego is on the road and a continuous line is present"
- ψ is ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line)) which means "it is not the case that ego crosses the continuous line or ego straddles the continuous line"
- Using De Morgan's law: ~(A | B) = ~A & ~B, so ψ becomes "ego does not cross the continuous line and ego does not straddle the continuous line"
- The predicates follow the interpretation rules: on_road(ego) → "ego vehicle is on the road", present(continuous_line) → "continuous line is present", crosses(ego,continuous_line) → "ego vehicle crosses the continuous line", straddles(ego,continuous_line) → "ego vehicle straddles the continuous line"
- No temporal bounds are specified, so this is a global property without specific time intervals

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is on the road and a continuous line is present, then the ego vehicle does not cross the continuous line and does not straddle the continuous line.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is on the road and a continuous line is present, then the ego vehicle does not cross the continuous line and does not straddle the continuous line.

- ψ is ~(crosses(ego,continuous_line) | straddles(ego,continuous_line)) which means "it is not the case that ego crosses the continuous line or ego straddles the continuous line"
- Using De Morgan's law: ~(A | B) = ~A & ~B, so ψ becomes "ego does not cross the continuous line and ego does not straddle the continuous line"
- The predicates follow the interpretation rules: on_road(ego) → "ego vehicle is on the road", present(continuous_line) → "continuous line is present", crosses(ego,continuous_line) → "ego vehicle crosses the continuous line", straddles(ego,continuous_line) → "ego vehicle straddles the continuous line"
- No temporal bounds are specified, so this is a global property without specific time intervals

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
